folder: Barclay Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
83-81 Barclay Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of West Broadway, also showing 27-29 West Broadway, adjoining and at the S.E. corner of Park Place.

July 29, 1914.

Wurts Brothers.

folder: West Broadway & Barclay Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
12 West Broadway, adjoining the S. W. corner of Barclay Street. This structure projects thru this block to front on Greenwich Street, where it bears No. 227.

July 29, 1914

Wurts Brothers

folder: Barclay Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
138
(1) Barclay Street, south side, west from and including West
Broadway.
July 26, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

(2) The same at a later date and showing site cleared for the new Post Office.  Elevated shown on Church Street is the sixth
Ave. Line.
March 13, 1934.
P.L. Speer.

(3) Barclay Street and West Broadway,note "L" station at Greenwich
Street.
June I93I
George L.Balgue,

folder: Barclay Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
52 Barclay Street, adjoining the S.E.  corner of West Broad-way.
July 26,1930.
P.L. Sperr.

folder: Barclay Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
Barclay Street, south side, east from, but  not including West Broadway, to, but not including Church Street. Buildings shown, will be razed to form a site for the downtown Post Office.

July 26, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Barclay Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Barclay Street (right), south side, west from West Broadway (foreground) to West Street. Shown on Greenwich Street is the Ninth Ave. Elevated structure. At the left are buildings that bear West Broadway numbers. The huge edifice apparent in the background is the
New York Telephone Building, No. 140 West Street.
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, slightly more inclusive. The three buildings on the left being Nos. 14 to 10 West Broadway and 229 to 225 Greenwich Street;
being units that continue through the block.
May 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

text:
46-54 Barclay Street, east of, adjoining, and at the S.E. Corner of West Broadway. No. 46-48 is the Journal of Commerce Building.

folder: West Broadway & Barclay Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
West Broadway, west side, south from and including Barclay, to Vesey Streets. Also shown is Barclay Street, south side, west from West Broadway, to and including Greenwich Street. The Barclay Street Station of the Ninth Ave., Elevated, is shown on Greenwich Street.

June 5, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
